title: Plant Physiology Increases the Magnitude and Spread of the Transient Climate Response to CO 2 in CMIP6 Earth System Models
citation: Zarakas, C. M., Swann, A. L., Laguë, M. M., Armour, K. C., & Randerson, J. T. (2020). Plant physiology increases the magnitude and spread of the transient climate response to CO2 in CMIP6 Earth system models. *Journal of Climate*, 33(19), 8561-8578.

title: Informing Future Risks of Record‐Level Rainfall in the United States
citation: Sanderson, B. M., Wobus, C., Mills, D., Zarakas, C., Crimmins, A., Sarofim, M. C., & Weaver, C. (2019). Informing future risks of record‐level rainfall in the United States. *Geophysical Research Letters*, 46(7), 3963-3972.

title: Reframing Future Risks of Extreme Heat in the United States
citation: Wobus, C., Zarakas, C., Malek, P., Sanderson, B., Crimmins, A., Kolian, M., ... & Weaver, C. P. (2018). Reframing future risks of extreme heat in the United States. *Earth's Future*, 6(9), 1323-1335.
